Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: quiltyrendfou
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best locations in Rome for sightseeing -- the 64/40 busses stop here making it an easy trip to the Vatican and the train station, very close walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The hotel itself was good -- especially b/c the staff was so nice and friendly. The place has a chintzy look to it though. My room was close to the reception and I needed earplugs at night. It's a good place to stay but ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Clare T
Reviews.Content: This boutique style hotel, is in a brilliant location! You can walk to everything and public transport/taxi rank on your doorstep. The room was well appointed, with tasteful furnishing and very comfortable bed. The staff were friendly, welcoming and very helpful. We travelled on to Sorrento and on our return, they allowed us to leave our luggage at hotel for a few hours while we had a few hours in Rome before catching a late flight home. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and intimate”
Reviews.Author: Lism0re
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in eary June 2011. What a find. Right in the middle of everything so that you can walk to where you want to go. The staff were obliging and went out of their way to get us to where we needed to be for tours etc. Food was great, bed was comfortable room very elegant. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: badeente24
Reviews.Content: In the city for a business trip with a little sightseeing, the location of the hotel couldn't have been better. Public Transport (which i didn't need) is right out door, yet the room was really quiet and I slept great. If you arrive by cab have them drop you off on the Corso and walk the maybe 5 meters to the hotel (right in front of the tram stop). The room (number 5) was a decent size with a big bed, sofa (which could be an additional bed) plus a small desk and chair. The shower could easily fit two as well. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was decent (generous by the Italian standard of a cup of coffee). Only downside for a business trip, there is no wlan. The front area has a terminal with free internet available though plus a small section with tour guides in multiple languages.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Argentina - my favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: komari a
Reviews.Content: You know what, this hotel really impressed me a lot. I cannot believe that I found such a modern, classy, and elegant hotel like this in Rome. Whether you are with your friends or family, Residenza Hotel will still be the best place to stay in Rome, Italy. Hopefully, when I come back in Rome, I will be able to stay there again. This is the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: julian s
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay in Residenza Argentina. I just cannot think of bad things to say about this hotel because for me, it is just so perfect. During my stay here, the staff accommodated and treated me warmly. My expectations in a hotel was indeed surpassed by Residenza Argentina. Try to stay here some time!

Reviews.Title: “Finally.. the hotel I've been looking for.”
Reviews.Author: juris g
Reviews.Content: I had so many business trips in Rome but I must admit that this is the first time that I've stayed in a hotel like this. I can't help but blame myself because I did not stay here before. I will always consider to stay again in Hotel Residenza on my next business trips. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Going to Rome? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: zandro c
Reviews.Content: Actually, it's my first time to go to Rome. I think I am just one of the happy tourists who do not just love Rome but also Residenza Hotel. The hotel is just so perfect for me. Even my family loves it. I really can't believe that this kind of modern hotel can be found in Rome. Oh, I almost forgot.. their services are also superb. I just loved my stay there.. Next time I go to Rome, I will stay to this hotel again. Promise!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikko i
Reviews.Content: Residenza Hotel is one of the hotels where I stayed during my business trips. It's actually the latest and the best hotel for me so far. I cannot see any flaw in this hotel. Everything is just so perfect. The staff in the hotel really assure that you will have a great and comfortable sleep. The design of the hotel is just so elegant, classy, and modern. I almost forgot that the scenery outside is historical. :)

Reviews.Title: “I've never been in a hotel like this before!”
Reviews.Author: sheenajam
Reviews.Content: I love to spend my extra time to travel to some places around the world. Since I love exploring different countries, I've stayed to many hotels already. However, I can say that Residenza Argentina is really exceptional. Facilities and equipments are really superb and the hotel staff assure that their customers are safe and feeling comfortable. I've had a great sleep and I enjoyed taking pictures there too. I feel lucky to find such a lovable hotel. 100% recommended!

Reviews.Title: “I strongly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fredo g
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to go to Rome, here is a tip for you. Do not look for any other hotels there, just go straight to Residenza Hotel. Service is really superb. Hotel style is awesome. My stay is really memorable and comfortable. I really recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “It's just amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mikel s
Reviews.Content: I think Rome is a very great vacation destination. I made a good choice in picking Residenza Argentina! I was kinda surprised when I entered inside because their facilities really look modern. I stayed in a comfy and modern hotel that is located at a very historical place. I treasure all my travel experiences in Rome as well in Residenza Argentina!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous srroundings and friendly management”
Reviews.Author: loli074
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully decorated with modern fixtures. It had a fine bar. It truly is a boutique hotel.The all-night staff was available to help me catch transportation to the airport. I had to leave very early. and hope next time to have breakfast.There are trams to the airport in front of the hotel. As I recall, they were #64 and #40, but one should check. In all, the management is helpful and congeial, and the hotel is lovely and clean. The location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back”
Reviews.Author: GalwaygirlSinead
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for our first time in Rome. It's not a hotel, more a B & B which is on the 3 floor of an apartment building. Like all the other reviews it's hard to find. We found the airport transfer brilliant. We booked the transfer by email to the hotel - €50 was well worth it between the 3 of us, the same price as getting the train in from the airport. Can't imagine trying to struggle around the streets of Rome with luggage. The hotel is in such a central location with bus & tram stops right outside. You can walk to everything. After a day walking around the vatican your feet will be very happy to hop on a bus right back to outside the hotel. To catch the bus for the vatican you go across the road to outside the bookshop on the left. We didn't find the noise at night bad, to be honest if you are sightseeing around Rome, you'll be too tired to hear anything. Found the staff very helpful/friendly. There were 2 staff, one on the day shift and one on the night shift. Breakfast was good, no hot food just cereals, fruits, breads, cheeses, etc and really good coffee. There are lots of places to eat right near by - really like the pizza place nearest the traffic lights on the left. Has more than pizza and has lots of authenic food.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tariag
Reviews.Content: This "residenza" is actually a luxury design b&b in an large apartment in Rome. It's really difficult to find, although it's on a large square, but when you finally get in it, it's really beautiful and the service is great. Considering that you are in a big european capital (look at the prices in "real hotels"), it has a very good value. The rooms looks really like a 4-star hotel! We had #3 and had nothing to complain about. The only bad point is that the rooms are a little noisy (you hear the tramway passing and people yelling from the street) but apart from that, everything was perfect! The situation is very good also, within walking distance from piazza navona and the ghetto, where you can eat the famous "carcioffi". I warmly recommend this place if you don't mind the little noise and the fact it's a very small, hard to find hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All the basics done to perfection, at an awesome price”
Reviews.Author: MangoPutney
Reviews.Content: I've opened an account just to write a review for this place. A 6 bedroom hotel hidden away in a courtyard in a central location, this did exactly what we needed for a 6 nations rugby weekend. By basics I mean - decent sized room, network cabling for laptops in room, *extremely* clean (rooms returned to spotless every day), great bathrooms, lots of towels, great continental breakfast, brilliant brilliant service at a fantastic price. It's clear that there is real pride in the quality of service here. We will be back in two years time.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & all you need for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelling_pandas
Reviews.Content: We recieved a warm welcome and took the hotel up on the offer of an airport transfer which meant the driver took us straight to the hotel door. The hotel is behind large wooden doors and through two courtyards but this means it is quieter and offers great security. The small lift is a bonus in such an old building and can fit two people or one person with some luggage. Booked a 10 night holiday in the suite (room 4) which is spacious and comes with a very welcome jacuzzi bath for two in the bedroom. Great to enjoy a soak after all the walking! The bathroom is large and has a shower unit and large towel rail. The bed is two single beds together were firm but comfortable. Pillows were rather flat and hard but were adequate. The room lacked a set of drawers which meant we had to hang most of our clothes and use the small drawers in the cupboard, this probably won't be a problem for those on a short stay. The cupboard also had a safe which was easy to use but could do with a light in the cupboard to see. The room had a useful mini bar where we could store cool drinks. Range of wine, spirits, chololate and water in the room. Our room has fresh flowers on our arrival and a complimentary bottle of Prosecco which was warmly recieved. The hotel management were efficient, friendly and offered a very personalised service to suit. Much more relaxed than big hotel chains. The breakfast could either be delivered to our room but we chose to get it ourselves and there was no problem in getting a tray to take it back to our room which is just beyond the main reception area. there is a small bar and some seating in the reception. The bar is reasonable and offers hot drinks and alcohol. The room has a small falt screen TV, DVD player and sound system - useful for plugging in your MPS player/phone. Wifi is available for 6 euros for your stay. A computer and small library of guide books etc are there for general use. Overall a fantastic location within easy walk of all major sights. Tram junction right outside also a taxi rank across the road. A small supermarket is across the square and plenty of eating places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, a little street noise but overall a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: acass1
Reviews.Content: This is an excellently-placed hotel for exploring Rome - we walked everywhere from here. It's just round the corner from the Pantheon. The rooms are lovely, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The entrance is a little strange (access via a shared courtyard and intercom) and we almost walked past it at first. Breakfast was a little bit limited, and the central location results in a bit of street noise at night, however we would consider staying here again as the location is brilliant and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsShipp
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location, walking distance of everything. Great staff, clean modern rooms, good value. Entrance won't be what you are used to as you approach via intercom and courtyard but not a problem as on call 24 hours a day and they stress that too. Also they sent us an email prior to arrive explaining where it is which really helped, very easy to find though as next to the theatre. Breakfast a bit basic but nice and a good way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Got what was expected”
Reviews.Author: jholstea
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at this hotel. The hotel was very clean and there was an elevator (which was great since it was on the 4th floor). There was also a safe in the room and a private bath. The location was excellent and with 2 blocks of the train station. The staff weren't super friendly, but were nice enough. We got what we expected for the price in the dowtown rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: makariogatos
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be better !! The staff is extremely helpful and there is a "family" feeling !! Breakfast can be improved considering the total cost. The rooms are nice although the strong element of that residence is the location and the service of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service even before we got there”
Reviews.Author: Aussie00000
Reviews.Content: We read all the wonderful reviews about this place and tried to book it directly via email, for a family trip in 2010. The staff blatantly refused to answer our questions about the room size and type and even refused to proceed with our reservation. A blessing in disguise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: DPRoberts51
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel in the heart of old Rome lived up to what we read about it. The hotel is intimate (6 rooms) on the third floor of a residential building located within a 10 minute walk of most major attractions. While the area is very busy, the rooms are located back form the busy street and are reasonably quiet, with new windows keeping out most (but not all) noise. This is not a full service hotel, but a comfortable charming and friendly place to stay in a colorful neighborhood. There is a small lift form the lower floor to make getting the luggage up easier. Bathrooms are very clean and modern. Our bathroom had a generous sized enclosed tub shower with good water pressure. Stepping in and out over the high tub sides might be a bit difficult for older or disabled visitors, but more of a minor hassle otherwise. The hotel staffed by the brother-owners 24 hours a day. They brothers are very congenial and helpful. They arranged shuttle service (taxi) to and from FCO upon request. We had the same (very pleasant) driver both ways. Breakfast is a reasonable assortment of breads, juice, fruit, ham & cheese, yogurts, and really tasty cappuchino - no hot items, but quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Genial”
Reviews.Author: ChantalGeneva
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great breakfast, wonderful ambiance, very quiet , very helpful and friendly staff who arranged bookings, transport, bus routes etc. There is a lift, although small, as well as a bar and SKY tv. Recommend to anyone. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service, very comfortable - Go!”
Reviews.Author: tiggerwoods
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay at the Residenza Argentina . The hotel is effectively on the 3rd floor of a block but don't let this put you off. Our room (IV) was very comfortable (jacuzzi bath, shower, mini bar etc.) and the service is excellent (very good English). Five minutes walk gets you to the Pantheon, Isola Tiberina and the Wedding Cake (Piazza Venezia - you can pick up a tour bus here) and about 10/15 to the Colosseum. Castel Sant Angelo and even the Vatican are walkable. There is a taxi rank in the Largo di Torre Agentina if you prefer not to walk. The hotel provides a good continental breakfast to keep you going till lunch or at least your first snack of the day . No wifi but wired internet access (they will supply a lead for your laptop if you ask). Fresh towels everyday. Very happy to have picked this place for our 25th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise! Great value”
Reviews.Author: Mirkotravel
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this place (note: it isnt really a full Hotel with all the usual amenities, but does the job if you dont require concierge service, gym, restaurant etc.). The standard of the rooms is very good (I would say about 4-stars). I had free Internet access. The breakfast is basic, but ok as it was included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “A FANTASTIC experience at Residenza Argentina”
Reviews.Author: Renoir184
Reviews.Content: YES, YES, YES to Residenza Argentina. This fantastic little boutique hotel was our home away from home in Rome. Firstly, the staff were absolutely outstanding. They are helpful, friendly and willing to do almost anything to ensure your stay is comfortable. They welcomed us at night and greeted us with a smile in the morning. We stayed in the hotel both at the beginning and the end of our trip, so we had Room 4 (with a jacuzzi) for the first few nights and then Room 6 for our final night. Both were fantastic. The rooms are clean, well cared-for and very well maintained. We had clean towels every day when we returned from our sightseeing and there is plenty of soap and shampoo provided. The morning breakfast was excellent - and the cappuccinos were a great way to start our day. By paying 6 Euro for our entire stay, we have free access to a computer and the Internet which we used to communicate with home on a regular basis. There is a real sense of security also in the hotel. You have to buzz in from the street and you first enter two large courtyards. You then have to buzz once again to be let into the building itself, where you climb into the VERY small elevator for the journey up to the third floor hotel. You then have to buzz once again to get into the actual hotel. All of this sounds a little awkward - but it is not at all - easy as can be. The location of the hotel itself is absolutely perfect. It is right in Largo Argentina - a bit of a transportation hub. From there, you can catch a bus or a tram right outside the hotel door. It is within walking distance to Piazza Venezia (a hub) and also within walking distance to the large attractions: Campo dei Fiori (5 minutes), Piazza Navona (5 minutes), the Pantheon (5 minutes), the Colisseum (10 minutes), Travestere area (10 minutes). The square outside of the hotel is also a taxi waiting area so you can catch a cab to Termini if required. Overall, I have to give this hotel a 10+++. We loved every aspect of it, will recommend it to all of our friends who are planning on a visit to Rome, and we will DEFINITELY return to this hotel. Our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nimrodd
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel, very central and convenient for the sites. The room was modern, spacious and spotlessly clean. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was fairly standard european fayre.

Reviews.Title: “Our room had a jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: scopey
Reviews.Content: Room was superb and the staff were really friendly. Nice breakfast and service was excellent from arrival to departure. You don't get a key to the main door and I thought i would be annoyed at having to buzz to get in, but I wasn't at all. The guys are always there to let you in no matter what time you get back. Overall, much better experience than staying at a large, soulless hotel. We used to always go for the expensive soulless option, but this changed our view - now we want the small chic boudoir! And if you want to book, just call them direct - we did and they spoke excellent english and they matched the internet prices.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel well situated five minutes from Piazza Navonna”
Reviews.Author: Ojaitraveller
Reviews.Content: This charming place was tucked away inside an inner courtyard behind garage doors facing the sacred ruins near Teatro Argentina. The three of us squeezed into t hetiny elevator and loved it everytime. We loved the location, the price and breakfast. They made great cappicinos and served cheese, ham, fruit and great breads daily. Everything was fresh and newly renovated. A very sleek modern Italian interior with old world charm coming into the place. We had a loft unit that slept three. It was tiny...my husband could almost reach the both walls when he extended his arms. My son said his bed was a little short...but he was fine. There were very steep stairs up to the loft and the bath was upstairs. If steep or steps is a problem for you, be sure you don't get this room. Great bus connections were just out front. Lots of good eating and night life nearby at Piazza Navonna or Campo del Fiori. If you need a lot of space...these rooms are not for you!!! But we felt like we were natives staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic small, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: julietz
Reviews.Content: a lovely little hotel, well furnished and good breakfast. very reasonable prices and great location for all of Rome's main attractions. the suite is particualry nice too. staff very friendly. can be hard to find but its well worth it!! have stayed here twice now and booked out the whole hotel for our friends when we got married in rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice staff but be aware...”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and modern and the staff (usually the one manager at the desk) is very friendly and helpful. However, guests must be aware of several things: The entrance to the residence is located in a busy square behind a set of rail tracks. This means if you plan on arriving by taxi with any luggage, you must get out in the middle of the street next to the curb, carry your bags 50 steps over the rail tracks to the outer doors that are always locked, ring the front desk from outside, then once you are buzzed in you walk into a courtyard about forty steps to another set of doors, must be buzzed in again, and finally you have reached the elevator. This elavator is small even for European standards. It fits exactly two people and no luggage. Once you get to the third floor, you enter a third door and you have finally arrived to the residence. And you must be buzzed in at each door every time you come and go. This may be suitable if you travel light and only exit the hotel once all day, but it was terribly inconvenient for me. Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, otherwise a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travellinghappySY
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel after finding good reviews about it on this website. There were both good and bad points to the hotel so I'll start with the good. Excellent location. Well within walking distance of all the tourist attractions. Furthest being vatican probably about 40mins stroll away. Public tram stop virtually outside the hotel enterance, for those less mobile, or the city sight seeing buses stopped on the main street no more than 5 mins walk away. Staff. I found all staff to be friendly and helpful and all spoke English to a reasonable standard, and were able to help with directions and taxi transfers to the airport on our departure day. Breakfast served 7am - 10am so good if you're setting off early on departure day. Now the bad... The hotel, although set back from the main road through a courtyard, does back on to a side street and our room (No 4) was noisy at night (and well into the night too) with the bars/restaurants on the side street. Other rooms may not have been this noisy depending on which side they were on. The breakfast. Lovely coffee, and selection of teas available but the breakfast consisted of bread with cheese and meat, croissants, yoghurts, cereals, and cake. The croissants with chocolate spread were nice for the first day but after that something else would have been nice, like toast or an omelette. Also the breakfast is served in the reception area of the hotel which is directly outside all the rooms and so you sometimes get woken by other guests dining if you're wanting to sleep a little later. The Room. We booked the Junior suite (with jaccuzzi) and I was disappointmed at how small the room was. The cloth covered walls (?!) were dirty, and the jacuzzi area was in the bedroom and so close to the bed that the bedding got wet as we got out. The bathroom was always spotless but the shower screen didn't fit properly allowing water to leak onto the tiled floor Being unaware of this on our first day my partner stepped out onto the tiled floor and slipped and twisted his ankle and bruised his leg. All in all we were not hugely impressed with this hotel. The main redeeming feature was the central location but it did not outweigh the negative points. We would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: NYnomad
Reviews.Content: This was a great little bed and breakfast (it's definitely not big enough to be called a boutique hotel with only 5 rooms) in a central location and good service. The room I had was a duplex and was large. The bathrooms are a good size although europeans seem to love these narrow upright showers. The facilities are clean and the breakfast was adequate. I would also recommend this place in comparison to other b&b's because I had stayed at two earlier in this trip and noticed there was not elevator. But low and behold, this one does so that is certainly a perk for someone who after spending two weeks there, had a 50 lb bag! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Galbionix
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in their suite, for the beginning of our honeymoon! Location is unbeatable, right in the middle of the city with easy access to all the historical places. The room was amazing, modern furnishing, lots of comforts and a huge jacuzzi in the bedroom which we found great after a long day of walking in busy Rome. The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast, a little limited but a fresh croissant & a nice cappuccino were a great start of the day anyway! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A very safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights the second week of May. The room was a good size for the two of us. A good location in the Largo Argentina area. The tram stops right in front of the building and the bus line to almost anywhere is about a block away. It is part of an old "palace?" and the building is used by several boutique hotels and businesses. The security is great. The six rooms of the hotel are on the third floor of this building and you have to be buzzed in to open the gate. Also at night, they lock the outer doors to the street and you have to be buzzed in too. They have free internet with ethernet direct connect in the room. It is nice when you have your own laptop. Dislikes: Could have used larger wattage in bulbs. Also would have liked a more varied breakfast. It was the same choices everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: The_Finnish_Flash
Reviews.Content: Visited Argentina Residenza for 5 days in middle of May. We had booked 2 double rooms and in one room a baby cot because we had our 7 month old baby with us. We booked it directly with the hotel. We also booked the transfer from airport via the hotel and it worked perfectly both ways and therefore we had no problem finding the hotel, but I understand everyone saying it´s difficult to find the hotel. The rooms where nice and clean and the bathrooms had a hydromassage in the tub (we didn´t use it though). Breakfast was rather small but had everything necessary. Cereals, ham, cheese, rolls, juice and croissants and you could order nice capuccinos. The location was perfect. Short walk to "everything". Less than 2 km to the Vatican, Colosseum and the Spanish Steps. Less than 500 m to Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Campo di Fiori. And then to the negative things. The employers english was not good and therefore, two of our restaurant reservations were non existing when we arrived at the restaurant. Otherwise they were very friendly and helped as well as they could. The second thing that disturbed us was the small elevator because in the evening when we got back and our baby was asleep, the stroller couldn´t fit in the elevator and the baby woke up when we carried him to the room. If you don´t need to take a stroller in the elevator and you won´t let the employers make your reservations, this place is excellent. We will recommend this place to everyone going to rome and we would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of location, price, and comfort”
Reviews.Author: jjkdc
Reviews.Content: I spent a long, long time researching for a small intimate hotel in Rome that offers a great combination of location and comfort at a good price. This hotel has that combination. It's only a few blocks south of the Pantheon and an easy walk from both Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori. Plus, it's kind of cool walk out on to the street every morning to be greeted by the ancient ruins of Largo Argentina, where it's believed Julius Caesar was stabbed many centuries ago. There is a bus stop right around the corner, which makes getting to/from the Termini train station a breeze. I, like several reviewers before me, found getting to the place to be a little confusing....just grin and bear it, it's all part of the fun of being in Rome, right? My room was small but comfortable, had a minibar, and a bathroom up a short flight of steps. Although the hotel is in a very old building, it does not have much in the way of "old world charm" - it has a modern feel, yet is still unique enough to be interesting. The staff I interacted with were very friendly, though their English is only rudimentary. They serve a great breakfast, with cereals, pastries, fruits, etc. They make a fine cup of cappuccino as well. At 145 euros/night (single), I could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: seanmsd
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe this hotel was a three star hotel. My five night stay was very enjoyable. Once I figured out how to enter the hotel (through unmarked double doors to an entrance in the second courtyard) I discovered my oasis in the middle of Rome. Unlike many hotels, the pictures correctly depict the hotel. Modern, chic and clean - overall the hotel standards seemed higher than other three stars. The room was spacious. The street was a bit noisy but it wasn't anything that kept this light sleeper awake. What was impressive was the attention to detail. There was satelite TV which provided numerous English shows. The best and most used feature was the jet tub which helped relieved my tired feet and body. The continental breakfast was ample providing items from cereal, to pastries, to fruit, to cheese and ham. The location was amazing, from where I could walk to all the major sites. Actually, it was in the exact middle of all the main attractions. The area was great for finding restaurants, cafes, etc. This place is a definite return destination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location of the Residenza Argentina”
Reviews.Author: Reisduif
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residenza Argentina in February 2007 and can say it was an enjoyable stay. Location was excellent, in the middle of the old city centre within walking distance to everything. Bus, tram and taxi stands were right in front of the building at the piazza. Tram did produce some noise, though, but mainly in the morning . One had to get up anyway, so it was no big deal. Traffic in big cities always produces noise. We didn't get a key of the two outside gates, so every time we had to ring the bell, which was a bit of a hassle, but I guess it keeps some unwanted people out of the inner courtyards, which the Residenza shares with other residents. The building the Residenza Argentina is situated in has a lift. It's small, but you don't have to drag your suitcases up several flights of stairs. Room was modern and clean and so was the bathroom with shower and bidet. One night we were informed that there wasn't any hot water as the boiler had broken down. I guess this was exceptional. The boiler was fixed the next day. Breakfast was buffetstyle and offered enough choice. Only negative point was that the bread was rock hard (had been in the oven too long) and there was no fresh fruit. The staff was very friendly. Can recommend the place, despite the minor negative points. I booked the Residenza Argentina via a hotel booking website but it's cheaper to book a room directly at the Residenza!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrscraigster
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after being recommended by a friend, and I have to say what a lovely hotel it was. The room was absolutely beautiful and the spa bath at the end of a hard days walking in Rome was well appreciated!! Location was fantastic, you could walk everywhere from here. This was the first time we have been to Rome, and when we go back, we will definately book the Residenza Argentina.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little find”
Reviews.Author: trave1bug5
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a mid-week break with a friend and we had a great time. The room was perfect for us, and the bathroom was great. We loved the continental breakfast each morning. We returned to the room each afternoon for a siesta and the air conditioning was just luxurious. The location is ideal for walking to all the tourist sites, even in the August heat. The Pantheon must be no more then 3 minutes away! After we struggled to find the place on our first day we could not have been happier. The hotel is on the busy side of Via de Torre Argentina next to the theatre - not the quiet residential side near the bookshop as we were led to believe. But after a phonecall or two, a member of staff came to meet us and ushered us back towing my friends suitcase behind him.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't now stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Wales
Reviews.Content: I returned last night from what was my third trip to Rome and I now know where I'll stay every time I visit again in the future - Residenza Argentina. The location was perfect - we walked everywhere including to the Vatican which only took about 45mins at a very leisurley pace! We were a group of eight and so I got to see 4 of the six rooms and each was very nicely decorated and of a very decent size. Our room was room three. The bathroom as in the others was of a very high standard, complete with jacuzzi bath (ask for a room with a jacuzzi - I think three of the 6 have one.) The staff were excellent - very attentative, and recommended some great places to eat, especially in the Trastavere. Usually when my fiance and I go on a city break we book the very best hotel we can - 9 times out of 10 a 5 star hotel. This time we were with friends some of whom were on a budget and that's why we went for Residenza Argentina, but without a doubt this is where we'll stay next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two amazing things about this B & B: 1) The location cannot be beat!! 3 minute walk to the Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Campo de Fiori; 6 minute walk from the Roman forum, Campodoglio, Trastevere, and Trevi Fountain; 10 minute walk to Spanish Steps and the main shopping area; 15-20 minute walk to the Vatican; Coliseum, Arch of Constantine. We literally never took a cab anywhere. Tons of restaurants nearby, located right off a main street, very easy to find. Another nice feature is though the entrance is right off a main road, the actual B & B is 200 feet back through a courtyard and then through another security gate, so you don't hear any of the street noise off of Argentina. As with most properties located in Rome, you will occasionally hear some street noise, even though the double paine glass, but it is incidental at worst. 2) The room itself was amazing!! The size of the room and the bathroom were huge by European standards. The bathroom was all marble, with a stand up shower which had great water pressure and never lacked hot water for a minute. The room had the equivalent to a standard king size bed, which was two twins pushed together......firm, but not rock hard. Flat screen TV with Sky satelite. We had the room with the jacuzzi, which we did take advantage of every night as our feet did ache from all of the walking....it was well worth the additional Euros. The decor was modern with plenty of lighting. It really was a perfect room for two. The breakfast in the morning was standard fare for European B & B, breads, juices, Nutella, cheese, ham, expresso, coffee, cappucino, more than adequate. The only negative I can think of is that while the front desk staff was extremely attentive, they were not able to provide a great deal of information about where to eat or what to do. Which for us was ok, since we like to find our own way through a new city, but I would imagine some could be disappointed by this. Bottom line, for the money, there cannot be a better deal in all of Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbum
Reviews.Content: Close to all the plazas we wanted to go out, especially Travastere, a big going out section for young people, this hotel was superb in location. We also had an extremely low price per night, considering our room was the Junior Suite, and we had a jacuzzi in our room. The rooms were extremely clean and very modern, which I liked very much. The front desk was extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast was simple and nothing special. The only problem was getting out of the hotel and finding it...a few problems since the hotel is located inside a residential building, but overall, we loved this hotel and would stay here again if we went back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Beware your Reservation”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get a WRITTEN CONFIRMATION for your room at this cozy hotel. After you get it, CALL the hotel to confirm it. After getting my written confirmation TWO MONTHS AGO, I sent an email a week before we were leaving just to make sure they had my reservation. Lo and behold, they told me I never confirmed it and now the hotel was full! When I emailed them a copy of THEIR confirmation, they offered to help me find another hotel. I don't know....there are plenty of hotels in Rome....why stay somewhere that does not honor reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome on Sat 11th Feb 06 had a wonderful time, seen all the sights in 3 days. Hotel was lovley, clean and confortable, very central for all sights, staff helpful and friendly. If there was one thing I would say that I would have like cofee/tea making facilities in my room, but that's because I like a coffee before I get up in the morning, but their cappucino was lovely with breakfast. We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Location”
Reviews.Author: JIHK
Reviews.Content: Reasonable sized rooms with great bathrooms positioned aorund a central greeting area which doubles up as a breakfast area for a simple cold breakfast of croissants and coffee. Spotlessly clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic very close to the Pantheon and a short walk to Palatine and Colosseum. They also can arrange a reasonable transfer to the airport which works out cheaper than the local taxis depending upon traffic. Hotel was great and would recommend. Only down side is a very simple breakfast but bearing in mind the cheap restaurants and all the sightseeing to do, it actually makes a lot of sense just to snack and get out in the amazing streets of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Disaster in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: no lifts for a thrid floor, the people from recepcion are unpolite and they don´t mind about the customers, I am a pilot, I travel a lot and tried this place with my wife because the opinions in this page, don´t trust and don´t loose your time in Roma. This is the worst treat you can get in this town, we stayed only one day when we were suposed to stay for three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: camgl
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fantastic trip, staying for three nights in this fabulous hotel in the centre of Rome! The Argentina Residenza is perfectly situated on the Largo di Torre Argentina which is great for public transport and also has the ruins of several ancient temples. It was also great for exploring all areas of the city on foot- we walked to the Vatican, the Spanish steps, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and Trastevere from here. The surrounding area has lots of great cafes and restaurants- you must try the Pizzeria da Baffeto on via governo vecchio and the Antica Taverna- absolutely gorgeous food - and great people. The hotel only has 6 rooms which made it friendly and intimate and is set back from the busy main street via a pretty courtyard entrance. We stayed in the Suite which had a very comfy double bed, flat screen tv, sky tv, dvd player, mini bar (reasonably priced) room safe and a huge jacuzzi bath in the bedroom!! The bathroom also had a great powerful shower, lots of towels, bathrobes and toiletries. Breakfast great - cereals , breads, lovely cappucino! The staff were always pleasant and helpful. All in all we couldn't have picked a better place to stay and would definitely return to the Argentina Residenza- and Rome- the most amazing city in the world!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: byss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a weekend in Rome, we had a great time and loved the hotel Argentina Residenza. You won't find the services of a big hotel but won't miss them either. Rooms are very clean and the hotel has a very modern look (you appreciate it more after seeing the Coliseum!) and the bed is quite comfortable (up to european standards', to the States' it might be a bit hard)We will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Romantic, Peaceful and Chilled place to stay in a beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Argentina Residenza in November 2005 with my Boyfriend for his birthday. I spent a long time looking for the "perfect" place to stay, and I have to say I found it in Argentina Residenza. Rooms were a generous size, bathroom had a shower big enough for two! and plenty of storage space. No english channels on the TV, but hey, you don't go to Rome to watch TV! Fridge/Mini Bar, electronic safe, and air conditioning. Value for for money and well worth every penny. Location was perfect, trams, buses stop right outside the hotel - going in every direction. However, My Boyfriend and I ended up walking everywhere as all the beautiful attractions Rome has to offer were within easy walking distance. Located behind a courtyard, so you get peace and quiet to chill out in your rooms with no noise level from the street. Staff were very friendly and relaxed - the rooms were cleaned every day and always helpful to provide information. Even had a smile on their face when we are arriving back to our rooms at 4am in the morning!! Breakfast was nice to start the day of with - and the immediate area has some great resteraunts, cafe's, and pizzerias. Piazza Navona, Camp De Fiori, are all within a very short walking distance. The Vatican is just a 5 min bus ride away as well. Highly recommend this Residence and will certainly be staying here again when I return to ROME.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean room, good shower! Perfect location in the centre of Rome but still very quiet. In fact so quiet it's almost too quiet. Great stay and would go back. Magic!!

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Argentina
HotelInfo.Address: Via di Torre Argentina 47 | Largo Argentina, 00186 Rome, Italy
